author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1699259354}
review:
Dwarflings is yet another of several hundred, if not thousands of garbage low effort endless runners plaguing Steam.  Admittedly there's a simple twist to this one, but it still amounts to the same thing.  Like all endless/autorunners, you're moving and you can't stop.  All you can do is avoid the obstacles coming at you in this incredibly shallow shovelware game.  The big difference is you can tap on your iPhone screen to change between runner "modes" (mining or running faster).  You need to switch between modes to pass through various obstacles in each level.  Thats it, that's all there is to this.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

While there are options to change the resolution for the game, all this does is scale up the simplistic 2D art assets used to make the game, which makes little or no difference to the graphics quality.  Without any other substantial graphics tweaks, it's not possible for gamers to improve the lacklustre 2D visuals.

The game features simple, cartoony 2D graphics, of the type you normally expect to see in low effort mobile apps.  3D graphics programming does require a degree of skill and competence and unfortunately not all developers have the budget or talent to deliver this, despite 3D graphics cards hitting the mainstream in the 1990's.  Considering this is being evaluated as a PC game, having the graphics phoned in like this isn't going to result in a high quality, visually impressive game that PC gamers are used to seeing.

The developers didn't design the game for modern gaming PCs, as such the display resolution caps out at 1080p, a very low resolution that became mainstream back in 2006 and became obsolete when 4K entered the mainstream in 2014.  The game simply won't look right on modern gaming displays due to this failure on the part of the developers.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just iPhone screen tapping stuff.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

This looks and feels like a mobile app, but it doesn't seem to have made it to the app stores.  It's unclear why this was put on Steam instead of the app stores it seems to have been designed for.  Maybe it was removed, maybe it was rejected by Apple and Google (they do have more rigorous quality standards than Valve does for Steam, after all).

Regardless, for all intents and purposes Dwarflings might as well be a mobile app, it has the same limitations and dumbed down qualities.  It's impossible to recommend such a game to PC gamers.  We don't spend all this money building gaming rigs so we can pretend they're iPhones and play games that might as well be mobile apps.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

You don't have to take my word about how bad the game is, we can measure the interest in a game by how much people bothered to play it.  Dwarflings has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game absolutely failed to capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for completing the simple tutorial level, trivial to achieve, but less than 10 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  That's a tiny, tiny proportion of gamers who even bothered with this.  Ouch.

Dwarflings is relatively cheap at $3 USD, but it's not worth it. Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198892703103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1684321163}
review:
I bought this in 2020 and didn't progress past level one.The reason is simple , as like other people's copies it crashes, with very few appearing to have a working version. It's a pity as other games from this company are fine, but despite promises , they have failed to make any adaptations.

There were reports of problems, years before my purchase, so it pays to check reviews before you buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017962331', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1682366467}
review:
L'idée du jeu est bonne, un groupe de nains avec chacun des capacités pour avancer vers la sortie.
C'est un genre de casse-tête plus ou moins difficile avec des aides que l'on peut acheter à un marchand pour se facilité la tâche.
Le jeu est très lent et avec un mauvais clic on est bon pour tout recommencer.
Avec le temps on s'habitue à la mécanique et on commence a apprécier.
Par contre, immense coup de gueule envers les concepteurs du jeu, il est bourré de bug qui provoquent des crashs, j'ai réussi a faire les 1ers niveaux en mode fenêtre, mais impossible de finir le jeu, et d'avoir 100% aux succès steam, car le dernier niveau crash sans cesse (d'autres commentaires dans ce sens).
Aucune réponse des développeurs.
Je ne peux qu'émettre un avis négatif.

Modification de mon avis après plusieurs échanges par mail avec Daniel un des développeurs : il est resté actif et par soucis de satisfaire les joueurs, a identifié les bugs du jeu et les a corrigés plusieurs années après la sortie de ce dernier. Bravo pour le travail ! Il est maintenant possible de finir le jeu.
Merci pour le travail fourni

author: {'steamid': '76561197966015988', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1668947122}
review: A nice realtime puzzle game inspired by Lemmings. Nice art, nice humor. I'm not a big fan of puzzle games, but this one I really like and recommend. There is one drawback though: at first it's a bit slow (really needs some time warp), but later it requires even too much reaction when puzzles become more difficult and involve several dwaflings. But anyway, it's worth the money, give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990627522', 'num_games_owned': 11358, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1682612302}
review:
First of all, this game is broken in the current moment, it randomly crashes from time to time and I wasn't able to finish it - it crashes ALWAYS at the same moment in one of the final missions.
But let's assume this is not a broken game.
This is some variation about old game Lemmins with it's own ideas. So it's mix of logic, timing and little of dexterity.
But is it good as Lemming? Absolutely not. I remember playing Lemmings and that was pure fun. And playing Dwarflings was mix of frustration and boredom – even for such dwarfs fan as I am. Many of levels are just too long and when you will do something just half a second not in time, you need to repeat whole level and this time hope to do everything perfect.
Second thing is waiting, it’s very common in this game that you just need to wait for your dwarfs to return to the place where they should be, so you just have to watch how they walk and do completely nothing during that time. For me this is not definition of having fun. It’s as funny as watching for paint drying.

VERDICT
This is broken game first of all.
Second of all, it's boring and frustrating, so please keep away from it. There are MANY good games out there.

If you’re dwarves fan and want to check other games about/with dwarves, consider to follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42612053-Dwarven-Kingdom/#browse]Dwarven Kingdom[/url] curator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142366455', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1574604198}
review:
Do not buy this, it is a terrible excuse for a game.  It says it is "Lemmings meets Lost Vikings" but both of those were clever, well thought-out games that were fun - this is definitely not.  Add in the covert in-app purchases and I think you have the measure of its design.

In short, you click one of a few icons to get the dwarf you are controlling to do something.  The game has no charm, subtlety or depth.  I am fairly sure that very few people continued far in, judging by the % ratings on each achievement.  It only appears that I have played it for 11 hours because I idled it for the cards.  I will now be uninstalling it and not wasting any more time on this poor effort.

The one thing I will be taking from this is that I will not buy anything else by this dev.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966174472', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1531917676}
review: Juego pésimo, aunque parece el típico juego de cavar y recoger oro, no lo es, un puzzle plataformas de un minero que practicamente no recoge oro porque te mueres a cada paso, pero eso no es lo peor, es muy lento en su movimiento, muy torpe a la hora de darle las ordenes, perdiendo ordenes y avocandote a morir y lo peor es la camara, que ni si quiera sigue al personaje, vamos, que el genero de rompecabezas se basa en que te busques la vida para poder jugar, la parte más dificil del juego, lo cual es absurdo tener que andar con teclado y ratón en un juego tan simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118005728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 566, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1531294469}
review: Dwarflings is an almost good game. It has a decent, maybe a little crude artstyle, funny characters and the music and sounds are okay. It's actually fun, but the controls are clunky and not as responsive as they should be. Platformers must have good responsive controls! Granted, all you use is a mouse, but dang, get it that one button right for goodness sake! Bad controls are not challenging, they are annoying. Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041457591', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1518644521}
review:
Let me get one thing straight: I don't downvote this game because of the crude graphics. While they're far from pleasant (and the sounds are average at best), I've recommended worse. These get the job done. And the interactive story telling is even relatively good.

No, the main reason I downvote is one I'm surprised isn't mentioned more often: the game tends to react slowly or not at all to your reactions. At first I thought I misclicked or something, but it's worse: assign a task when your guy is walking, and he will carry it out at the NEXT block rather than instantly. This means you have to assign tasks literally before you want them to happen (but obviously not too far before). It's this part that got on my nerves the most.

It's a shame. While honesty requires me to say I doubt it'd be incredible quality, I see what the developer wanted to make.  And the levels I've seen certainly weren't bad...it's just that I had to restart them over and over because my execution wasn't flawless. Honestly: it baffles me that others are eagerly comparing it to lemmings. On paper that comparison is certainly valid, but there's something really wrong if a 25+ year old game reacts better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135438892', 'num_games_owned': 4732, 'num_reviews': 5177, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1516752802}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993372725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1516566755}
review: The game looks like it should be good. It has nice art, all right characters, is an interesting combination of puzzle and platformer... but the game just isn't fun to play. Finding the solution to a level is easy enough, but getting the clunky controls to actually do what you want them to do causes you to die repeatedly. Clicking buttons on the right time; timing your movements to coincide with the monsters' movements (which is quite hard since there is no "wait" button, just "move" or "move faster" so be prepared to run back and forth between walls until you feel the timing is right).. this is just not fun challenges.

review:
Dwarflings is fine.  My problem is, I have a question for Steam about one of their other games, Hoyle Card Games, that has a terrible reputation in the testimonials section, and I want to ask Steam if they are intending to include a newer or older version that is more popular than the one currently on offer.

However, for the life of me, I cannot see how I can contact any live human being at Steam or Valve.  If I can't ask simple questions, I will be giving them the big elbow and finding a supplier who is prepared to talk to customers.

Les Brown

author: {'steamid': '76561198300270231', 'num_games_owned': 5388, 'num_reviews': 894, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1498805042}
review:
오크와 고블린이 점거한 광산에서 탈출하기 위한 드워프의 발버둥 [b]《난쟁이 드워프들》[/b]이다. 게임 방법은 정말 간단하다. 적에게 죽지 않고 탈출지점으로 이동하면 된다. 그래, 나도 초반에는 개쉬운 전략 게임 중 하나라 생각했다. 하지만 20레벨 언저리쯤 가면, 정말 혀를 내두를 정도의 무자비한 레벨 디자인에 개쌍욕을 내뱉는 경우가 비일비재하다.

 + 드워프마다 각기 활용 방법이 다르다(이게 '전략 게임'인 이유다)
 + 개같이 많은 레벨 디자인(나에게는 단점에 가깝다)
 + 속도 조절 기능이 있다
 + 일시중지 기능이 존재한다
 + 트레이딩 카드 존재(포기하지 않는다면, 플탐 대비 파밍시간 적절)

 - 캐릭터 스위칭 방식이 존​​​​나​​게 불편하다
 - 후반으로 갈수록 줌 땡겨서 보기만 해도 토 나오는 레벨 디자인
 - 개​​병​​​​​신 같은 캐릭터 간 거리 계산(레알 이게 이 게임을 어렵게 하는 가장 큰 요인이라 생각한다)
 - 동료 드워프 하나가 죽은 상태에서 레벨을 클리어하면, 그 드워프는 다음 레벨에 참여하지 못한다
 - 살리려면 상인에게서 포션을 사야하는데, 포션 살 돈이 없다면 다음 레벨을 진행할 수가 없다
 - 그래서 울며 겨자 먹기로 하위 레벨로 내려가 골드 앵벌이를 해야한다(ㅋㅋ 개노답)
 - 도전과제 올클리어가 정말 굉장히 매우 많이 대단히 빡치는 편이다
 
 진심, 초반 1~20 레벨 정도 까지만 그나마 쉽게 갈 수 있다. 그 이후에는 수시로 내 뜻 대로 안 되는 드워프들의 개썅마이웨이 조작에 치를 떨며 욕을 내뱉을 것이다. 간만에 엄지를 내려갈겨보는 리뷰다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016096893', 'num_games_owned': 11947, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1489857856}
review: Очень напоминает по смыслу Леминги, но конечно та игра конечно всегда останется классикой. Тут персонажи гораздо крупнее, но это не значит что управлять ими будет легче. По все игре встречаются различные нестандартные квестовые навороты, которые помогают в той или иной мере пройти препятствия. Начинается все с одного подопечного на первых уровнях, но потом увеличивается до пяти,  что создает огромную сложность. Все это напичкано добрым сказочным юмором, подчеркнуто красивой графикой и приятной музыкой. Врятли понравится любителям неспешных головоломок, ведь тут нужно соображать очень быстро и тем более молниеносно управлять чтобы выжить. Хорошая интерпретация легендарной игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255826538', 'num_games_owned': 5403, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1489941621}
review: Забавная головоломка, понравится не всем, так как нужно думать логически. В игре гномы которым нужно пробраться к выходу и собрать побольше сокровищ. сделать это не просто, так как они так и норовят упасть в пропасть или еще что, если вы вовремя их не направили в нужное русло, или не выбрали нужное действие. В игре приличная стилизованная графика, все доброе, не смотря на гибель персонажей. Перед тем как делать цепочки действий лучше грамотно осмотреть карту и прикинуть куда идти в том или ином случае, это уменьшит число ошибок, так как полностью их в любом случае не избежать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272374716', 'num_games_owned': 13029, 'num_reviews': 3562, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1493115336}
review:
[h1]«Dwarflings»[/h1]
Казуальная стратегия + аркада + приключение.

Геймплей напомнил старые, классические игры «Lemmings» и «The Lost Vikings». Только в «Dwarflings» мы управляем не огромной толпой леммингов, а несколькими гномами. Они постоянно двигаются, а стукнувшись об препятствие разворачиваются и идут в обратную сторону. Выбираем нужного гнома и задаем ему желаемое действие щелкая на специальные иконки внизу экрана (или нажимаем соответствующие кнопки на клавиатуре).

Элемент стратегии в том, что надо рассчитать какое и когда действие задавать гномам, учесть траекторию их пути, чтобы они не разбились и не попали в лапы врагов.

«Dwarflings» отличается от своих предшественников большей аркадностью и казуальностью. Игру можно рекомендовать как взрослым, так и детям. В игре мультяшная рисованная графика, приятная музыка, много забавных анимированных сценок и диалогов. 
Игра поддерживает русский язык. Приятно читать все эти забавные шутки и историю освобождения гномов на родном языке. Это порадует тех, кто не очень силен в английском (особенно детей).

[u] Вы можете почитать другие отзывы и подписаться на наших кураторов. Добро пожаловать! [/u] 
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/25737869/] 5 minutes of game [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198280440677', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1493306478}
review:
[h1] Dwarflings [/h1]
[i] A platformer which requires one basic thing. Common sense. Rush yourself through the mines to escape the orcs! 7/10 [/i]

[h1] Story [/h1]
[i] You are a Miner who mines ore for the Orcs. Your goal is to find your friend Figli and both escape from the Orc mines. With the help of friends you find the way to escape by your own, no instructions given except from the tutorial level [/i]

[h1] Pros about the game. [/h1]
+Low spec, can run on a 250$ rig with everything on full quality.
+Challeging, as I said above you need to have your wits with you to complete each level.
[b] +Beautiful graphics, even for a platformer. [/b]
+Many,many levels!
+Trading cards.

[h1] Cons about the game [/h1]
[b] -No instructions given, as said above. (Only on the very first level) [/b]
[b] -Doesn't have many graphics options, for more low-end rigs. [/b]

[h1] Personal Opinion [/h1]
[i] Even though it's action based, I would recommend this to anyone who wants to spend a little time playing a platformer and take a break of the Triple A titles. Also, trading cards are included to this game :) [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198101497677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1491080184}
review:
This is a really likeable tactical puzzle game with oldschool taste which feels like the mix of Lemmings and Commandos. Here're some reasons why you would like it (without particular order):
1. Art is simple, but very nice and with great attention to details, and quite a lot of them make you smile.
2. Rules and controls are very easy to learn, you do not really question how to play the game, you just play.
3. Levels are well-thought and each built around its own idea. There's no complexity for the sake of complexity. Many of them will make you scratch your head, but once you get it right you go through. It never gets too long to bore you. Harder levels are sometimes followed with the easier to relax a bit, and then there's a new puzzle.
4. Funny characters, humourous dialogs and even intriguing plot really brings life into the game, and you really can't wait for the next cutscene. 
5. Although it's early access, the game seems to be of release quality. I guess early access status is only caused by the limited amount of levels, and I personally will wait for more with eager (especially if it gives me a chance to see Tortilla again!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198048373881', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1481810542}
review: A nice realtime puzzle game inspired by Lemmings. Nice art, nice humor. I'm not a big fan of puzzle games, but this one I really like and recommend. There is one drawback though: at first it's a bit slow (really needs some time warp), but later it requires even too much reaction when puzzles become more difficult and involve several dwaflings. But anyway, it's worth the money, give it a try!
